oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Olivia Woods oral history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Woods, Stenia Olivia Murray
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpts of an oral history with Olivia Woods, the first African-American student at Middle Tennessee State University. Woods shares her memories of attending college at MTSU as both an undergraduate and a graduate student during the 1960s and 1970s

1. Woods' experiences as first MTSC African-American full-time undergraduate student -- 2. Woods' and son's experiences on campus as African-Americans -- 3. Woods' experiences with female dress code -- 4. Woods' experiences as graduate student during 1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; African American college students; African American graduate students; Race relations; Women college students; Dress codes; Middle Tennessee State University
